meanings.definition: A person who heels or repairs shoes.
meanings.sent1: The heeler fixed my favorite shoes perfectly.
meanings.sent2: The heeler at the shop is very skilled with shoe repairs.
meanings.sent3: The heeler joked that he could fix shoes in his sleep.
meanings.sent4: She was a heeler, stitching soles back together like a magician.
meanings.sent5: The heeler's craftsmanship made the worn-out shoes look brand new.

meanings.definition: A breed of dog known for herding cattle.
meanings.sent1: The heeler rounded up the cows with ease.
meanings.sent2: Heelers are intelligent dogs that excel at herding livestock.
meanings.sent3: The heeler playfully nipped at the cows' heels during herding.
meanings.sent4: The heeler moved the cattle like a furry conductor directing an orchestra.
meanings.sent5: Watching the heeler work was like witnessing a canine shepherd in action.

meanings.definition: A type of shoe with a thick, high heel.
meanings.sent1: She wore stylish heelers to the party.
meanings.sent2: The fashion store displayed a variety of trendy heelers.
meanings.sent3: The heeler shoes made her feel taller and more confident.
meanings.sent4: The heeler boots clicked loudly on the pavement as she walked.
meanings.sent5: Her favorite pair of heelers added a touch of elegance to her outfit.

meanings.definition: A person who supports a political candidate or cause.
meanings.sent1: She was a dedicated heeler for the mayor's campaign.
meanings.sent2: The heeler attended every rally to show support for the cause.
meanings.sent3: The heeler proudly wore campaign buttons all over her jacket.
meanings.sent4: He was a heeler who passionately advocated for his chosen candidate.
meanings.sent5: The heeler's enthusiasm for the political movement was contagious.
